description: Moors Murderer Ian Brady reportedly asked in his will for his cremated ashes to be scattered in Glasgow's River Clyde and for money raised from publishing his memoirs to go to charity.
title: Moors Murderer Ian Brady reportedly asked for money raised from publishing his memoirs to go to pet charity

author: Sarah Whitehead
description: Ashworth hospital staff talk of difficulty in setting aside the crimes of the Moors murderer to treat him like any other patient
title: Ian Brady's psychiatric nurses speak of 'daily miracle' of treating him

author: Frances Perraudin
description: Murderer’s solicitor assures coroner that 79-year-old’s remains will not end up on moors where he and Myra Hindley buried victims
title: Ian Brady's ashes will not be scattered on Saddleworth Moor, lawyer confirms

description: Moors Murderer Ian Brady was so desperate to avoid the death penalty in the 1960s that he revisited the body of one of his victims to replace money he had stolen, The Telegraph can reveal.
title: Exclusive: Ian Brady planted money at victim's grave in ploy to avoid death penalty
